keymap.knob_not_support: 現在のファームウエアはノブのカスタムをサポートしていません。ファームウエアをアップデートしてください。

layer.1: Temporarily activate layer n. Once the key is released, the layer will deactivate. The Fn key on the keyboard typically uses this setting.
layer.2: Change the state of layer n: if it is inactive, activate it; if it is active, deactivate it.
layer.3: When holding down this key, the layer will be activated and deactivated upon release (similar to MO). Repeated tapping will toggle the layer on or off (similar to TG). By default, this requires 5 taps.
layer.4: Temporarily activate layer n until the next key is pressed.
layer.5: Activate layer n and deactivate all other layers (except the default layer). This unique function allows a lower layer to replace a higher layer. It activates when the key is pressed (as long as the key is held down).
layer.6: Temporarily switch the default layer to layer n. Note that this is a temporary switch and will be invalid after the keyboard is powered off.

setting.unlockTip: Turn on the travel unlock to unlock the 0.2-0.4mm operation distance adjustment, at 0.2-0.4mm the trigger will become very sensitive and easy to accidentally touch, please pay attention after turning on.

distance.magnet_calibrate_tip: Trigger Demo supports only a single key
distance.magnet_calibrate_tip_desc: Select a key and turn on the switch button upper right to demonstrate the trigger of the selected key.
distance.magnet_calibrate_tip_empty: キーを選択してください
distance.desc: トリガー距離が短ければ短いほど、スイッチの感度が高くなり、押す距離がより短くなります。
distance.speed_desc: Continuous pressing triggers dynamically. The shorter the trigger and reset distances, the more sensitive the switches become.
distance.profile_help: press "fn" + "p" + "z / x / c", you can quickly switch the profile to profile 1 / 2 / 3

multi_cmd.setting: 1つのキーで複数のコマンド
multi_cmd.fulfilled: Space full. Delete existing command to set a new one.

titles.5: Enable if you can type while the joystick is being simulated, disable if you cannot type while the joystick is being simulated.

calibration.1: Do not unplug the USB cable, disconnect the device, or turn off the device during calibration. Otherwise, the device may experience a device crash condition.
calibration.3: Do not press the keyboard key 2 seconds before clicking "Start Calibration".
calibration.4: Press and hold the key for 1 second to complete calibration.
calibration.5: When calibration is successful, the background light will be green.

snap_tap.title: Selecting 2 keys, the two keys are bound to allow for deeper key presses to trigger and shallower key reset.
snap_tap.title2: Selecting 2 keys, two keys are bound to enable the last triggered key to remain triggered and the other key to be released.
snap_tap.SC: You can set up two keys so that when both keys are pressed at the same time, you can have the one pressed deeper trigger and the other reset.
snap_tap.LKP:
Two keys can be set up so that when both keys are pressed at the same time, the last triggered key triggers at the same time as the other key resets.

Selecting 2 keys, two keys are bound to enable the last triggered key to remain triggered and the other key to be released.
snap_tap.RT: Press to the Bottom, both to be triggered

tips.0: There is no firmware update for the current device.
tips.1: Click the Connect Device button below and select the device that needs to update firmware.
tips.2: Detect whether the firmware is the latest version and whether you need to update the firmware.
tips.3: To update firmware, please click Next, and if you need to re-select the device, please click Reconnect.
tips.4: Please follow the steps below if you use a Windows device and have not installed Toolbox Driver. If you have already installed Toolbox Driver, click Next.
tips.5: 1.Click the 'Download Toolbox' button below to download and unzip Toolbox.
tips.6: 2.After unzipping Toolbox, right-click the Toolbox icon and click 'Run as administrator' to open it.
tips.7: 3.Open it and click on the menu 'Tool'.
tips.8: 4.Click 'Install Drivers', continue to click 'yes' to start installing firmware Drivers, and wait for the installation.
tips.9: 5.After the installation is complete, you can click Next to start the process of flashing the firmware.
tips.11: Please follow the steps below for firmware update.
tips.12: 1.In the current state, unplug the keyboard USB cable and let the keyboard disconnect.
tips.13: 2.While the keyboard is disconnected, press and hold the ESC of the keyboard and simultaneously connect the keyboard to the computer with the USB cable.Let the keyboard enter the state of preparing to update the firmware.
tips.14: 3.Click the Match Device button below, select the device that starts with STM32, and match it.
tips.15: 4.After successful matching, the 'Flash Firmware' button will appear, click it to start updating the firmware.
tips.16: (Do not disconnect the keyboard from the computer while flashing firmware.)
tips.17: Note: You can click on the Brush Firmware instructional video to learn more about the process.
tips.20: to understand the detailed process of installing Toolbox Driver.
tips.mouseTip1: 1. Connect the mouse using a USB cable.
tips.mouseTip2: 2. If the link is already linked and the match is already available. Click on the Brush firmware to start the brush.
tips.mouseTip3: 3. Do not unplug the USB cable during the swiping process.
tips.mouseTip5: 注：可以点击教学视频，了解详细流程。
tips.mouseTip4: Click the Connect Device button and select Bootloader.

info.3: Your current firmware version is outdated. Please go to Firmware Update to upgrade.
info.4: A new firmware version has been released.

tip.1: Windows users need to download Toolbox and install the built-in drivers in toolbox for the first time.

firmware.notSupport: This browser doesn't support Web USB. Please use other browsers, such as Chrome.
firmware.warning: Please refrain from removing the device or refreshing the page during the firmware writing process to prevent any potential damage to the device.
firmware.requestFail: Failed to obtain the device; check if it's in use by other programs.

step.1: Unplug the USB cable with the keyboard
step.2: Import the firmware that needs to be flashed
step.3: Connect the device to retrieve the latest firmware version information.
step.5: Press and hold ESC, and connect via USB cable to your PC in the same time

common.resetAll: This operation will delete all saved data. Continue?

dpi.dpiTip: Adjust the speed at which the mouse pointer moves in any direction, or configure its sensitivity level.
dpi.reportTip: Adjust how often the device sends reports back to the computer.

tip.leftLock: Left-click configuration is locked and cannot be configured.
